intro: Topobea boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian topobea, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, often with five petals. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
